job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: Help Create the Future of Our World's BuildingsABOUT ONBOARDÂ The real estate industryâs lack of data interoperability remains a persistent bottleneck to widespread adoption of intelligent building software. Software developers, data scientists and analysts use Onboardâs software to eliminate this barrier, and quickly acquire data for their smart building applications. Itâs our mission to provide easy access to building data, and power the future of digital building services. Onboardâs innovative platform uses machine learning and deep learning to rapidly classify and integrate various data streams, enabling data use-cases across energy efficiency, tenant comfort, security, maintenance, among others.Â Onboard is a bootstrapped business headquartered in Somerville, MA, and is the recipient of several awards from the US Department of Energy, Massachusetts Clean Energy Center and Accel VT. Onboard was founded in 2018, and the founding team has experience from seed stage to acquisition, across hardware and software products.Â Â ABOUT THE ROLEIn your first week, you can expect to develop and deploy a scraper to compile data from the web. In your first year, you will implement, evaluate and productize deep learning models from a variety of IoT data sources, and contribute to technical literature and intellectual property reporting.Â QualificationsExamples of prior success, achievements or work products in the field of ML and AIÂ Experience with deep learning frameworks such as Keras, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Theano, MXNetÂ Proficient with Python, R and data visualization toolsÂ A collaborative team member who is comfortable with ambiguity and eager to contribute beyond their expertise, in other areas of the businessÂ A self-directed researcher who can independently develop hypotheses, design experiments, set and meet milestones, evaluate results and clearly communicate outcomes to a diverse teamÂ An MS or PHD in Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or PhysicsÂ Compensation and WellnessRanges: $100,000 - $120,000 | 1% - 2% stock option planÂ Health insurance, 401K retirement planÂ 4 weeks paid time off, up to 24 hours paid time off for volunteeringÂ Greentown co-working office and remote work capableÂ INTERVIEW PROCESSEmail your resume to careers@onboarddata.io20 minute phone screen60 minute cultural Zoom fit InterviewCompensated take-home programming challengeÂ 90+ minute Technical & Design Zoom InterviewÂ We ask for two references, which can be provided at any timeÂ We Look Forward to Hearing from You!
